channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: What is mortgage fraud — and why does the Trump administration keep accusing officials of doing it?

item.title: Nearly 50% of adults are now ordering kids’ meals. ‘It’s economical and it’s filling.’
item.description: It seems we’re all in the mood for miniburgers and chicken fingers.

item.title: These companies are the economy’s ‘first responders’ to Fed rate cuts
item.description: Community banks are “Fed-policy translators” — and their shares are highly sensitive to central-bank decisions.

item.title: ‘The money went into his account’: Is my father trying to swindle me out of my grandparents’ $800K home?
item.description: “I came across a letter from my father’s bank showing a wire transfer of $195,000 from the buyer.”

item.title: Comex Gold, Silver Settle Lower
item.description: Gold settled 1.4% lower, down two of the past three sessions, and silver fell 2.5%, down three of the past four sessions.

item.description: Gain insight on Experian, SoFi Technologies and more in the latest Market Talks covering Financial Services.

item.title: DeepSeek Won't Sink U.S. AI Titans
item.description: Panic fueling the selloff of Nvidia, Broadcom and other tech giants is overblown.
